snippet: WISE--Alice J.,formerly of Eastchester, gently slipped off her mortal coil on March 2, surrounded by her children. Beloved wife and mother, grandmother and great- grandmother, devoted friend and daughter-in-law, she was an accomplished artist, folksinger, naturalist, and conservationist, and a dedicated civil rights, social justice, and peace activist. She will be dearly missed and long remembered for her wisdom, wit, beauty, and kindness to others... and her enduring love of nature and the arts. 1/3
lead_paragraph: WISE--Alice J.,formerly of Eastchester, gently slipped off her mortal coil on March 2, surrounded by her children. Beloved wife and mother, grandmother and great- grandmother, devoted friend and daughter-in-law, she was an accomplished artist, folksinger, naturalist, and conservationist, and a dedicated civil rights, social justice, and peace activist. She will be dearly missed and long remembered for her wisdom, wit, beauty, and kindness to others... and her enduring love of nature and the arts. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  WISE, ALICE J.
